titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Ethel C. Clarke Papers, 1942-1970
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 27769
titlepage.author: LVA Staff

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ethel C. Clarke. Papers, 1942-1970. Accession 27769. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The papers were given by Mrs. Mary Clarke Reams, Richmond, on 31 December 1971; via Mr. Hunter Martin, attorney for Ethel C. Clarke's estate, Richmond. Some photostats of records in the State Archives, purchased by Mrs. Clarke, were discarded. One map of properties in the western part of Clover Hill District, Chesterfield County, was transferred to the Map Department.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Ethel C. Clarke (1896-1971) was a professional genealogist who resided in Richmond, Virginia. She founded the Chesterfield County Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1942-1970, of Ethel C. Clarke (1896-1971) of Richmond, Virginia, consisting of genealogical research on several Virginia families; papers relating to the Chesterfield County Historical Society and the Daughters of the American Revolution; and items from printed sources including History of Flowerdieu Hundred; Margaret Lynn Lewis diary; Powhatan County, Virginia, tax list; and the Richmond City Directory. Papers also include her personal papers, including biographical, financial, medical, and legal papers, as well as correspondence with a real estate agent.

did.unittitle: Armistead family, 1635-1844 (also Bates, Burwell, Gregory, Higginson).
Ayres family, 1736-1920 (also Floyd, Hancock, Johnson, Nottingham).
Cheatham family, 1630-1929 (also Clarke, Dorset, Gates, Goode, Hancock, Matheny).
Clark-Clarke family, 1698-1963 (also Belcher, Jackson, Jones, Perkinson).
Miscellaneous (includes Batte, Beazley, Brackett, Carr, Cullum, Davis, Glover, Hobb, Hogg, Jones, Lowe, Morgan, Morris, O'Brien, Parham, Rudd, Sims, Tatum, Terry, Turner, Updegraff).
General census and tax lists information, 1800-1850.
Historical and geographical publications, 1954, 1967-1968, and undated.
Margaret Lynn Lewis' diary, typed copy, undated.
Property in Chesterfield County, 1881 and Richmond, 1962-1964.
G. B. Lorraine, Real Estate Agent.
